text: �and therein will be whatever souls desire and eyes delight in�He said:That is to say, whatever souls desire is the reward for their works, whereas whatever eyes delight in is the empowerment (tamkīn) which God bestows on them at the time of the encounter (liqāʾ) [with Him] as a reward for their realisation of His oneness (tawḥīd).[Then] he said:Paradise is the reward for works performed by the bodily members.
